name: Old Fashioned
about: The Old Fashioned is one of the oldest known cocktails, dating back to the early 1800s. It represents the original definition of a 'cocktail': spirits, sugar, water, and bitters.
instructions: Place sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass
Saturate with bitters and add a small splash of water
Add ice (preferably a large clear cube)
Express orange peel over the drink and place in the glass
notes: The Old Fashioned can be made with bourbon or rye whiskey, depending on preference. Some bartenders also add a small splash of soda water.
